data.taskTitle: Build generic filter engine using plugin-declared itemFields
Build generic filter engine using plugin-declared itemFields
data.approach: Create tools/ingest/lib/filterEngine.js with applyFilter(), validateFilter(), and resolveFilter(). All operators from the spec, AND logic, graceful handling of missing fields. Integration point is between poll() and dedup in scheduler.

data.taskTitle: Build generic filter engine using plugin-declared itemFields
summary: Created filterEngine.js with applyFilter(), validateFilter(), resolveFilter()
All 12 operators implemented: equals, not_equals, contains, starts_with, ends_with, regex, gt, gte, lt, lte, in, not_in
Graceful handling of missing fields and null/empty filters
Enum value validation against declared itemField values
reviewFocus: Check edge case handling (missing fields, invalid regex, empty arrays)

data.taskTitle: Build generic filter engine using plugin-declared itemFields
Build generic filter engine using plugin-declared itemFields
Build generic filter engine using plugin-declared itemFields
Build generic filter engine using plugin-declared itemFields

summary: Created filterEngine.js with applyFilter and validateFilter functions
Implemented complex filter logic with multiple operator types
Designed flexible filtering mechanism supporting plugin-declared item fields
Added comprehensive logic for handling missing fields and default behaviors

suggestedTasks.title: Add Unit Tests for Filter Engine Functions
suggestedTasks.description: Create comprehensive test suite for filterEngine.js covering all operator types, edge cases, and filter scenarios. Tests should validate core functions applyFilter and validateFilter with multiple input combinations. Focus on testing missing fields, default behaviors, and different filter condition types.
suggestedTasks.reason: No initial test coverage for new filter engine implementation

suggestedTasks.title: Document Filter Engine Usage and Configuration
suggestedTasks.description: Create detailed documentation explaining how to configure filters using the new filterEngine.js. Include examples of filter conditions, supported operators, field type constraints, and integration patterns with plugin metadata. Provide clear guidance for plugin developers on declaring item fields and default filters.
suggestedTasks.reason: New complex filtering mechanism requires clear usage documentation

patterns: Use metadata.itemFields for defining filter-compatible fields
Support multiple filter operators based on field type
Implement graceful handling for missing fields
gotchas: Empty filter defaults to pass-all behavior
Supports strict AND logic for multiple conditions

breakingChanges: New filter resolution order might change existing ingest behavior
documentationNeeds: Plugin metadata schema update for itemFields
